author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
A woeful tale from Eurozone's choir,
Its economy’s flame doth dim and tire.
In services grand and forges' fire,
Below forecast, PMI's numbers retire.

Royal Philips, with scepter unsteady,
Though bright is its quarter, future heavy.
At Citi's court, the verdict ready:
A modest sum of gold, for its 2023 levy.

In Europe's realm, oil's glow recedes,
A whisper of caution in the reeds.
Bated breath for the council's decrees,
The Fed and ECB hold the future's keys.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Economy Contracts Further, PMIs Suggest
feedItems.description: The Eurozone composite PMI, which gauges activity in the manufacturing and services sectors, fell to an eight-month low of 48.9 in July, undershooting expectations.

feedItems.title: Royal Philips Faces Uncertainty Despite 2023 Guidance Upgrade, 2Q Performance
feedItems.description: Philips’s 2023 guidance upgrade looks conservative given its second-quarter performance, which is likely to raise some questions, Citi said, which rates the stock neutral with a €19 target price.

feedItems.title: Oil Ticks Lower Ahead of Fed, ECB Meetings
feedItems.description: Oil prices remained lower in Europe in a possible technical retreat following last week’s rally, with investors looking ahead to this week’s Fed and ECB meetings.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
French data weak, bonds doth fall,
Merchants' cries echo in the hall.
An ale's predictable fall from grace,
Like France's plight, leaves bitter taste.

Yet in this time of market strain,
Brother Dollar's sight for gain.
Like the monk awaiting brewer's yield,
Ere the grain in fertile field.

Stellantis, thy sign is cast again,
Samsung SDI, thy inky pen.
A second shrine to craft electric ale,
On American soil, shall we prevail.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Fall After Weak French PMI Data
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields fell, reversing rises in earlier trading, after French PMIs came in weaker than expected.

feedItems.title: Dollar Could Get Boost From Fed Decision This Week, Market Positioning
feedItems.description: The dollar could get a boost from Wednesday’s Fed decision, where it looks “too early” for policymakers to switch to a data-dependent approach, ING said.

feedItems.title: Stellantis, Samsung SDI Team Up Again in US
feedItems.description: Stellantis has signed a deal with Samsung SDI to build a second battery factory in the U.S. to begin manufacturing in early 2027.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
The giant Philips, once held in delight,
Its earnings told, yet caused no great cheer.
A hoard of silver, yet ambition slight,
Didst analysts with stoic faces smear.

In distant reign of Vodafone, we learn,
The gold does grow, by three parts and seven.
Yet eyes towards future seasons stern,
Their omen for the earnings haven.

The Dragons of the East, their hoards retrace,
From Western lands, once ripe with plunder.
Turn now they must, to Indonesia's embrace,
Seeking wealth in nickel's glimmering wonder.

feedItems.title: Philips Targets Upgrade Fails to Impress
feedItems.description: Philips posted earnings of €681 million in the second and said it expected an adjusted Ebitda margin at the upper end of the high-single-digit range for 2023, but the upgrade disappointed some analysts.

feedItems.title: Vodafone Service Revenue Improves, Keeps Outlook
feedItems.description: Vodafone reported group service revenue growth of 3.7% in the first quarter and reiterated its fiscal 2024 earnings guidance.

feedItems.title: Chinese Money Flees the Western World
feedItems.description: Chinese investors who once bought New York City hotels and other Western assets are placing their money elsewhere, including Indonesia’s nickel industry.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
KPN in market's brawl, outcome doth not appall,
Their profit, in quarter, nigh to €596 mill fall,
While income sprouts, by sixteen percent tall,
Their outlook confirmed, stand strong, stand tall.

Ryanair's gain, of €663 million crowns, 
Yet lower traffic drowns, in Boeing's slowdowns.
Their forecasts top, yet caution frowns,
For future craft deliveries wear the crowns.

In Swiss land's hold, Baer's tale is told,
Assets under management, like strong fort bold,
Though inflows ebb, constrained by gold,
Their earnings solid, growing twofold.

feedItems.title: KPN Confirms Outlook After Profits Beat
feedItems.description: KPN reported second-quarter adjusted earnings of €596 million and a 16% rise in net income and reaffirmed its guidance for the year.

feedItems.title: Ryanair Tops Forecasts But Cuts Traffic Guidance
feedItems.description: Ryanair posted a net profit of €663 million for the first quarter but cautioned that traffic for fiscal 2024 is expected to be lower than previous guidance due to Boeing delivery delays.

feedItems.title: Julius Baer Reports Solid Earnings, Assets Growth
feedItems.description: Julius Baer reported a 9% rise in first-half operating income and assets under management of CHF441 billion and said net new money intake had accelerated in the last two months of the second quarter, but that inflows continued to be affected by client deleveraging.
